message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. I'm confident in its quality, and I'm willing to provide a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. But I think you'll love this product, and I'm sure you'll get a lot of value out of it. It's a one-time offer, and I'm only selling it to you for $100 today.
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'd like to think about it for a moment. Can you give me a chance to reconsider and make a decision later?

I completely understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to make sure you're confident in your decision. Let me sweeten the deal: I'll give you a 10-minute window to make a decision. If you decide to buy within that time, I'll throw in a complimentary accessory that complements the product perfectly. But if you wait too long, the offer will expire. The product is still a high-quality one, and I'm willing to let you take it home for $100.
I appreciate the additional incentive, Alice. I'll take the product and the complimentary accessory. I'll make the most of this opportunity.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous product, Bob! However, I want to be transparent with you about this next one. I've had some... issues with the manufacturing process lately, and I'm not as confident in the quality of this product. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $100, but I want to make it clear that it might not meet your expectations. If you're okay with taking on some risk, I think you can still get some value out of it. But if you're not comfortable, I completely understand.

Thank you for the honesty, Alice. I appreciate your transparency. Given the uncertainty about the product's quality, I'm going to pass on this one. I'd rather wait for a product with a higher chance of meeting my expectations.

I completely understand your decision, Bob. I respect your caution. Let me ask you this: are you willing to consider a 'lottery ticket' for this product? If you buy it, I'll give you a 20% chance to exchange it for a high-quality product of your choice from a future round, no questions asked. The 80% chance is that you'll get this low-quality product, but the 20% chance is that you'll get a high-quality one. The price remains $100, but I think this adds an interesting twist to the deal.

I'm intrigued by the lottery ticket concept, Alice. I'll take the risk and buy the product, hoping to get a high-quality one. I'm willing to take a chance on the 20% chance of getting a better product.

I'm glad you're feeling adventurous, Bob! However, I want to remind you that the lottery ticket deal was a one-time offer, and this product is a separate transaction. I'm not offering any guarantees or lotteries this time around. This product is a low-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm not trying to hide anything from you, and I think it's clear what you're getting. If you're okay with it, I'll let you take it home. If not, I completely understand.

Thank you for the reminder, Alice. I appreciate your honesty. Given that this product is low-quality and I've already taken a risk with the previous product, I'm going to pass on this one. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I completely understand your decision, Bob. I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you or sell you low-quality products. However, I do have a limited supply of high-quality products, and I need to sell them to make room for new inventory. I'm willing to offer you a 'clearance sale' on this low-quality product: I'll give you a 20% discount, bringing the price down to $80. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure when I'll have another opportunity to sell this product at this price.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.
